alert.note: Alert for Absaroka Mountains; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 6:52PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL HOT SPRINGS AND CENTRAL FREMONT COUNTIES THROUGH 730 PM MDT... At 652 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles north of Diversion Dam Rest Area, which is also 18 miles northwest of Pavillion, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Hot Springs and central Fremont Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Absaroka Mountains; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains
